oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics of Florfenicol in Veal Calves and its In Vitro Antibacterial Activity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Varma, K. J.
Adams, P. E.
Lobell, R. D.
Lamendola, J. F.
Houdeshell, J. W.
Powers, T. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Florfenicol
broad-spectrum antibiotic
food animal medicine
chloramphenicol
food animal
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The absolute ban on the use of chloramphenicol (CP) in food producing animals in the United States and Canada has accentuated the need for an effective broad spectrum antibiotic for use in food animal medicine. Florfenicol (FF), a structural analong of thiamphenicol (TP), is a new antibiotic being developed for use in veterinary medicine. The structure of florfenicol is shown in Figure 1. The hydroxyl group on the number three carbon of TP has been replaced by a fluorine to maintain the same special conformation. Florfenicol shows promise to be a very viable substitute for CP in veterinary medicine especially in food animal practice. The objective of our experiments was to determine the pharmacokinetic parameters for florfenicol in veal calves and its in vitro antibacterial activity which in turn will enable us to determine its proper dosage schedule.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Fifth Biennial Symposium; 109-126
